item.title: By: SRISHTI NAGU
item.dc:creator: SRISHTI NAGU
item.description:
Hi, Please some one tell how to make a best fit point in contour plots using gnuplot ??
Thank you
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
Please some one tell how to make a best fit point in contour plots using gnuplot ??

Thank you

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.content:encoded:
Hi Joe.

The easiest way is the one stated above

ax=10
ay=-1
plot '+' using (ax):(ay)

Otherwise you can do

ax=10
ay=-1
plot "<echo ".ax." ".ay

item.title: By: Joe
item.dc:creator: Joe
item.description:
How does this work with variables? i just get Bad data on line 1 of file < echo ax ay
But it does seem to work with explicit numbers.
item.content:encoded:
How does this work with variables? i just get
Bad data on line 1 of file < echo ax ay

But it does seem to work with explicit numbers.

item.title: By: lev
item.dc:creator: lev
item.content:encoded:
sorry,

plot “< echo ax ay” w p pt n

ax, ay do not need to be preset, you may write your numbers straight after "< echo"

item.title: By: lev
item.dc:creator: lev
item.content:encoded: plot "echo ax ay" w p pt n

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.content:encoded:
That’s true and it can be formulated even shorter using the special filename

ax=10
ay=-1
plot '+' using (ax):(ay)

item.title: By: Tim
item.dc:creator: Tim
item.content:encoded:
Makes me think

ax=10
ay=-1
plot "<echo 1 1" using (ax):(ay)

This is a bit of an abuse, but useful for calculated locations.

item.title: By: Iulian
item.dc:creator: Iulian
item.description: Thank you very very very much! That article helped me a lot!
item.content:encoded: Thank you very very very much! That article helped me a lot!

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description: Hi Johne, I made it by myself using <a href="http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/ rel="nofollow">Bootstrap</a> as a basis which is a very good start if you have some HTML/CSS knowledge. The color theme is inspired by <a href="http://tarskitheme.com/" rel="nofollow">Tarski</a> which I used for an early version of the blog.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Johne,
I made it by myself using Bootstrap as a basis which is a very good start if you have some HTML/CSS knowledge. The color theme is inspired by Tarski which I used for an early version of the blog.
